summary: An email from Deutsche Bank's Justin Alfano to prosecutors and others, attaching detailed transaction charts from Deutsche Bank's document production related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts. The charts show substantial financial flows involving Epstein, Leon Black, the Rothschild Group, various investment funds, and Epstein's trust accounts, revealing a complex financial network.

persons.name: Justin Alfano
persons.role: Director / Associate General Counsel, Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch
persons.context: Sender of the email, providing Deutsche Bank's document production including transaction charts related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of the email containing Deutsche Bank's transaction charts.

persons.name: Erika Engelson
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of the email containing Deutsche Bank's transaction charts.

persons.name: Vijay Dewan
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the email containing Deutsche Bank's transaction charts.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Subject of transactions in Exhibit A, showing millions in transfers to/from Southern Trust Company, often with Debra Black. Bloomberg reported he controls BV70 LLC.

persons.name: Debra Black
persons.context: Co-recipient with Leon Black in multiple multi-million dollar transactions listed in Exhibit A.

persons.name: Benjamin Edmond de Rothschild
persons.context: Listed in a transaction from Edmond de Rothschild (Suisse) SA, receiving nearly $15 million from Southern Trust Company in December 2015.

persons.name: Joichi Ito
persons.context: Listed in multiple transactions with Southern Financial LLC, receiving and sending hundreds of thousands of dollars.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central subject of the document. Exhibits detail capitalization of his Now/SuperNow accounts (Exhibit C) and transactions involving his trust accounts (Exhibit D). The Haze Trust and Gratitude America accounts are linked to him.

persons.name: Barry Jay Josephson
persons.context: Received $200,000 from Jeepers Inc. (Epstein's DB Brokerage Account) in November 2013.

persons.name: Adam Bly
persons.context: Received multiple payments, ranging from $3,500 to $100,000, from Epstein-related accounts between 2014 and 2015.

persons.name: Michelle Saipher
persons.context: Co-recipient with Darren Indyke of two payments totaling $1,223,000 from Epstein's accounts in May 2014.

persons.name: Gol Muchnik
persons.context: Received $500,000 from an Epstein-related account in April 2016.

persons.name: Sultan Bin Sulayem
persons.context: Received $6,200 from an Epstein-related account in July 2017.

persons.name: Jamie Mitchell
persons.context: Received $100,000 from an Epstein-related account in October 2017.

persons.name: David J Mitchell
persons.context: Received numerous payments from Epstein-related accounts between March 2018 and April 2019, totaling hundreds of thousands of dollars.

persons.name: Bruce Moskowitz
persons.context: The 'Bruce and Marsha Moskowitz Foundation' is listed as a recipient of multiple donations from the Gratitude America MMDA account linked to Epstein.

persons.name: Marsha Moskowitz

connections.description: Financial transactions link Black-controlled entities (BV70 LLC, Black Family Partners) to Epstein-linked entities (Southern Trust Company, Gratitude America Ltd.). A cited Bloomberg article states Black controls BV70 LLC, which funded Gratitude America.
Frequent co-recipients in multi-million dollar transactions listed in Exhibit A, suggesting joint financial activities.
Mitchell received numerous, sometimes frequent, payments from Epstein-linked accounts over more than a year, suggesting an ongoing financial relationship.
Bly received multiple payments from Epstein's Now/SuperNow accounts between 2014 and 2015.
Saipher, with Darren Indyke, received two large payments ($1.223M total) from Epstein's accounts in May 2014.
Indyke, with Michelle Saipher, received two large payments ($1.223M total) from Epstein's accounts in May 2014.
Alfano (Deutsche Bank counsel) is corresponding with Stemmer, likely a prosecutor or investigator, regarding document production.
Transaction shows a $14,999,980 transfer from Southern Trust Company (an Epstein-linked entity) to Benjamin Edmond de Rothschild in December 2015.

events.title: Leon Black $8.5M Transfer
events.description: Leon and Debra Black transfer $8,500,000 to Southern Trust Company, Inc.

events.title: BV70 LLC funds Gratitude America
events.description: BV70 LLC transfers $10,000,000 to Gratitude America, Ltd. A footnote cites a Bloomberg article stating Leon Black controls BV70 LLC.

events.title: Haze Trust Capitalized
events.description: The Haze Trust (DB Brokerage Account) receives a $20,000,000 deposit.

events.title: Major Haze Trust Internal Transfer
events.description: $36,000,000 transferred internally within The Haze Trust accounts.

events.title: Deutsche Bank Production Email
events.description: Justin Alfano of Deutsche Bank sends transaction charts to prosecutors/investigators, detailing financial flows related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank produced detailed transaction records showing millions of dollars flowing between entities linked to Jeffrey Epstein (like Southern Trust Company, Southern Financial LLC) and high-profile individuals like Leon Black, Debra Black, and Benjamin Edmond de Rothschild.
A $10 million transfer from BV70 LLC to Gratitude America Ltd. in 2015 is highlighted, with a footnote citing a Bloomberg report that Leon Black controls BV70 LLC.

The document details the capitalization and use of Epstein's 'Now/SuperNow' accounts for 'personal daily use,' showing incoming wires from his brokerage and third-party accounts, including payments to individuals like Adam Bly, Barry Jay Josephson, and David J Mitchell.

Substantial movements within 'The Haze Trust' accounts are shown, including multi-million dollar transfers to and from entities like Plan D LLC and Southern Financial LLC, as well as multi-million dollar payments to auction houses Christie's and Sotheby's.
The Gratitude America MMDA account, primarily funded by the $10M from BV70 LLC, made donations to charities including the Bruce and Marsha Moskowitz Foundation and the Melanoma Research Alliance.
